quizzes.question: Fill in the blank to create an opening html tag:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <html> Tag [/h1]

Although various versions have been released over the years, HTML basics remain the same.  

The structure of an HTML document has been compared with that of a sandwich. As a sandwich has two slices of bread, the HTML document has opening and closing HTML tags. 

These tags, like the bread in a sandwich, surround everything else:[code format="html"][b]<html>[/b]
 …
[b]</html>[/b][/code]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks:
[!raw!]
<{0}>
   <head> </{1}>
</html>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <head> Tag[/h1]

Immediately following the opening HTML tag, you'll find the [b]head [/b]of the document, which is identified by opening and closing head tags. 

The head of an HTML file contains all of the [b]non-visual elements[/b] that help make the page work. [code format="html"]<html>
[b]   <head>[/b]…[b]</head>[/b]
</html>[/code]
[note]The head section elements will be discussed later.[/note]

quizzes.question: Rearrange the code to create a basic HTML document structure:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The <body> Tag[/h1]

The [b]body [/b]tag follows the head tag.
All visual-structural elements are contained within the body tag. 

Headings, paragraphs, lists, quotes, images, and links are just a few of the elements that can be contained within the body tag.
 
[b]Basic HTML Structure:[/b] [code format="html" codeId="4"]<html>
   <head>
   </head>
[b]   <body>[/b]
[b]   </body>[/b]
</html>[/code]
